summary: An exception-definition creates a new exception-type in the enclosing package.
details: An exception-type is really a class-type that extends Throwable either directly or indirectly.
The new type inherits all the publicly-accessible constructors of its direct super.
The new type does not have any direct superinterfaces.
The new type does not directly define any fields or methods.
static-checks: Each annotation in an annotation-list must be uniquely typed.
No two types can share the same descriptor.
The type specified by super must exist.
The type specified by super must be accessible.
The type of super must be a class-type.
The super must be a subtype of Throwable.
The new type cannot be a subtype of itself either directly or indirectly.
example-1: module Main in examples;%0A%0Aexception Apocalypse extends RuntimeException;%0A%0Aexception Apophis99942 extends Apocalypse;%0A%0A@Start%0Adefun main (args : String[]) : void%0A{%0A    try%0A    {%0A        F::println(%22Oh look, a meteor?%22);%0A%0A        throw new Apophis99942(%22Oh no, an asteroid!%22);%0A%0A        F::println(%22The world survived!%22);%0A    }%0A    catch (problem : Apocalypse)%0A    {%0A        F::println(problem.getMessage());%0A        F::println(%22Ah well, back to the stone age.%22);%0A    }%0A}
